alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 12:55PM EDT until further notice by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in metro Southwest Broward County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in this area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Miami Gardens, Cooper City, Sunshine Acres, Royal Palm Ranches and Pine Island Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
